page.title: 05HOUSING - CHIGNALS
page.content: In this area houses are unevenly distributed, lying around the road network. Some parts have very few houses these being isolated farms. Many old houses have moats and large gardens e.g.Great Newarks. Most houses are old( i.e.fourteenth century designs),but a few have modern extension.Building materials include brick from the former local brick works, wood and tiles. Some houses have been divided into semi-detached, or converted into mansion style homes. Many houses are Tudor, Victorian, or Edwardian in age, some with unusual features e.g.Grays Farm has a horse hair ceiling. The roofs are mainly thatch,tile, slate or made from galvanised iron. **************************
